messages.content: What is Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI?
The Demofusion Custom Node is a wrapper that adapts the Demofusion technique by Ruoyi Du for use in the ComfyUI environment.
Where can I find the original Demofusion paper and implementation?
The original Demofusion paper and implementation by Ruoyi Du can be found at these links: https://ruoyidu.github.io/demofusion/demofusion.html and https://github.com/PRIS-CV/DemoFusion.
How do I install the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI?
To install the Demofusion Custom Node, clone the repository in the ComfyUI/custom_nodes folder and restart ComfyUI.
What is the minimum VRAM requirement for using the Demofusion technique?
The Demofusion technique requires a lot of VRAM (at least 18G).
Can I use local SDXL checkpoints with the Demofusion Custom Node?
Yes, you can now use local SDXL checkpoints with the Demofusion Custom Node.
What is the supported image resolution for the Demofusion Custom Node?
Square images with 2048x2048 and 3072x3072 pixels have been tested.
Which Huggingface models have been tested with the Demofusion Custom Node?

The tested Huggingface models are stabilityai/stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0 and stablediffusionapi/sdxl-unstable-diffusers-y, with the first one being the model used in the original paper and implementation.
